variables.name: childrenComponent
variables.description:
The tree's children component.

Override for a specific tree node by passing a different childrenComponent.

variables.name: contentComponent
variables.description:
The tree's content component.

Override for a specific tree node by passing a different contentComponent.

variables.name: expanderComponent
variables.description:
The tree's expander component.

Override for a specific tree node by passing a different expanderComponent.

variables.name: Node
variables.description:
Constructs a tree node.

Important: This API is only accessible from the {{basic-tree}}'s yielded block, or by using @tree.Node in the context of a childrenComponent.
Any other arguments which were passed to the tree.

functions.name: actions.toggle
functions.description: Toggle the tree node between expanded and collapsed

variables.name: isExpandable
variables.description:
Whether the tree node can be expanded and collapsed.

Defaults to true if the tree node was created in block form:

<tree.Node>
  ...
</tree.Node>

Defaults to false if the tree node was created inline:

<tree.Node/>

variables.name: isExpanded
variables.description: Whether the tree node is expanded. Defaults to false.

variables.name: childrenComponent
variables.description:
The tree node's children component.

Defaults to the childrenComponent passed as an argument to the {{basic-tree}}.

variables.name: contentComponent
variables.description:
The tree node's content component.

Defaults to the contentComponent passed as an argument to the {{basic-tree}}.

variables.name: expanderComponent
variables.description:
The tree node's expander component.

Defaults to the expanderComponent passed as an argument to the {{basic-tree}}.
Any other arguments which were passed to the tree node.

component:ember-basic-tree/components/ba.title: {{basic-tree}}
component:ember-basic-tree/components/ba.text: The main tree component <BasicTree as |tree|> <tree.Node @content="hello world"/> </BasicTree>

attributes.name: {{basic-tree}}
attributes.description:
The main tree component

<BasicTree as |tree|>
  <tree.Node @content="hello world"/>
</BasicTree>

arguments.name: contentComponent
arguments.description: Component used to render the content

arguments.name: expanderComponent
arguments.description: Component used to render the expander

arguments.name: childrenComponent
arguments.description: Component used to render the children of a node

arguments.name: nodeComponent
arguments.description: Component used to render the tree node

component:ember-basic-tree/components/ba.text: Renders the children of a tree node. Override this component by passing a childrenComponent to the tree or tree node.

attributes.description:
Renders the children of a tree node.

Override this component by passing a childrenComponent to the tree or tree node.

arguments.description: The node API, which includes all arguments that were passed to the node.

arguments.description: The tree API, which includes all arguments that were passed to the tree.

component:ember-basic-tree/components/ba.text: Renders the content of a tree node. Override this component by passing a contentComponent to the tree or tree node.

Renders the content of a tree node.

Override this component by passing a contentComponent to the tree or tree node.

arguments.name: node
arguments.description: The node API, which includes all arguments that were passed to the node.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: The tree API, which includes all arguments that were passed to the tree.

attributes.description:
Renders the expander of a tree node.

Override this component by passing an expanderComponent to the tree or tree node.

arguments.name: node
arguments.description: The node API, which includes all arguments that were passed to the node.

arguments.name: tree
arguments.description: The tree API, which includes all arguments that were passed to the tree.

component:ember-basic-tree/components/ba.title: {{basic-tree/tree-node}}
component:ember-basic-tree/components/ba.text: An node in the tree, constructed with the {{tree.Node}} API: <BasicTree as |tree|> <tree.Node @content="test"/> </BasicTree> Or in a childrenComponent using the tree argument: <@tree.Node @content="test"/>

attributes.name: {{basic-tree/tree-node}}
attributes.description:
An node in the tree, constructed with the {{tree.Node}} API:

<BasicTree as |tree|>
  <tree.Node @content="test"/>
</BasicTree>

Or in a childrenComponent using the tree argument:

<@tree.Node @content="test"/>

methods.name: onExpanded
methods.description: Action called when the tree node is expanded or collapsed

params.name: isExpanded
params.description: true if the node was expanded, false if collapsed

arguments.name: isExpandable
arguments.description:
Whether the node can be expanded and collapsed

Defaults to true if the tree node was created in block form:

<tree.Node>
  ...
</tree.Node>

Defaults to false if the tree node was created inline:

<tree.Node/>

template:docs/customization/children.title: Children
template:docs/customization/children.text: Children You can override the childrenComponent to render recursive data. The default children component yields to the parent block in order to render static content: Here we override the children component to create an infinitely recursive tree: Here we render a recursive JavaScript structure: Also see the .

template:docs/customization/content.title: Content
template:docs/customization/content.text: Content You most likely need to override the tree's contentComponent. The default content component simply renders the tree node's content argument: There's nothing special about content. You can pass any arguments and access them using @node.argName: You can access arguments that were passed to the tree using @tree.argName. In this example we pass a clicked action to the tree and access it from within the content component using @tree.clicked. You can override the content component for a specific tree node:

template:docs/customization/expander.title: Expander
template:docs/customization/expander.text: Expander The default expander component renders a triangle. It toggles the isExpanded state when clicked: Here we override the expanderComponent to use a different icon:

template:docs/examples/context-menu.title: Context Menu Example
template:docs/examples/context-menu.text: Context Menu Example This example integrates ember-basic-dropdown into the contentComponent to create a context menu for each node in the tree.

template:docs/examples/navigation.title: Navigation Example
template:docs/examples/navigation.text: Navigation Example This example uses LinkTo in the contentComponent to create a navigable tree.

template:docs/examples/recursive.title: Recursive Data Example
template:docs/examples/recursive.text: Recursive Data Example In this example, we render a recursive ember-data model which was loaded by the route's model hook. We override the childrenComponent to handle the model's recursive structure. We use the tree node's onExpanded action to sync the component's expanded state with the model's isExpanded attribute. The model will store the state of the tree if we transition to a different route.

template:docs/index.title: Overview
template:docs/index.text: Overview A customizable template-driven tree component. Most tree implementations want JavaScript data fed in with a specific structure. This tree's template-driven approach works with any data using normal Ember patterns.

template:docs/installation.title: Installation
template:docs/installation.text: Installation Install using ember-cli: ember install ember-basic-tree

template:docs/usage.title: Usage
template:docs/usage.text: Usage Here's a basic example which renders static content: Here we render some dynamic data using {{#each}}:
